sources.title: Pointed Heels (1929) WILLIAM POWELL üçïFAY WRAY üçïHELEN KANE
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: William Powell, Fay Wray, Helen Kane, Eugene Pallette
Director: A. Edward Sutherland
Story by: Charles Brackett 

Before Sunset Boulevard... The Lost Weekend‚Ä¶ and Titanic... 3x Oscar-winner Charles Brackett penned this rare pre-Code musical for Paramount Pictures!
 
A rare surviving gem of transitional Hollywood, "Pointed Heels" captures the industry in flux as it embraced synchronized sound. Directed by A. Edward Sutherland, this early musical drama blends backstage intrigue with the experimental energy of the talkie revolution.

The film features a standout performance by William Powell, whose signature charm and sophistication were already taking shape before his rise to 1930s stardom in The Thin Man series. Fay Wray, on the brink of iconic status in King Kong (1933), brings both glamour and depth to her role. But perhaps most historically notable is Helen Kane‚Äîthe original ‚Äúboop-oop-a-doop‚Äù girl‚Äîwhose animated persona inspired Betty Boop and helped define the Jazz Age in both music and film.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçï Be sure to LIKE, COMMENT, and SUBSCRIBE for more rare, vintage films every Friday on PizzaFLIX.

Also starring Richard 'Skeets' Gallagher, Phillips Holmes, and Eugene Pallette, "Pointed Heels" offers vital insight into the aesthetics, performance styles, and studio strategies of the pre-Code era. An essential piece for film scholars, early sound cinema enthusiasts, and fans of American screen history.
 
#PointedHeels #WilliamPowell #FayWray #HelenKane #BettyBoop #FilmHistory #PreCodeHollywood #ParamountPictures #1929Cinema #EarlyTalkies #Paramount Pictures #PizzaFLIX

metadata.Plot: Big-name musical performers experience everyday problems and disappointments during their offstage hours.
metadata.Writer: Charles Brackett, Florence Ryerson, John V.A. Weaver
metadata.Actors: William Powell, Helen Kane, Fay Wray
